column4: I have compiled and installed Application X (vim 7.3 in my case) to ~/Applications/ApplicationX-0.1/. It is in my path because it is sourced in ~/.bashrc. use the 'properties' for a file with the extension you want to assign to it.   and tell it to open with your new vim

it is however bgin sourced in my bashrc and I can start it from the terminal
however my graphical interface doesn't seem to be catching on (or sourcing my .bashrc)
i tell it to open with whatever app.. giving it the proper FULL path to the app..

because gnomedo is special.. and dosent do it that way.. its also proberly looking for the first item that matches in the path.
